Package etomica.data

Class DataSourceUniform

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.data.DataSourceUniform
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDataSource, java.io.Serializable

    public class DataSourceUniform
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDataSource, java.io.Serializable
    A DataSource object that provides a set of uniformly spaced values between two limits. Number of points and range can be configured. Range can be set inclusive or exclusive of end points (independently). A physical dimension (e.g., length, time) can be associated with the data at construction (only).

    Used principally to provide a set of "x" values for a function or plot.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Typed constant that indicates the way limits of the range are interpreted.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataSourceUniform

        public DataSourceUniform​()
        Default constructor. Chooses 100 points between 0 and 1, inclusive, and sets dataInfo label to "Uniform" and dimension to Dimension.NULL (which cannot be changed after construction).

      • DataSourceUniform

        public DataSourceUniform​(java.lang.String label,
                         Dimension dimension)

        public DataSourceUniform​(java.lang.String label,
                         Dimension dimension,
                         int nValues,
                         double xMin,
                         double xMax,
                         DataSourceUniform.LimitType typeMin,
                         DataSourceUniform.LimitType typeMax)
        Constructs a DataSourceUniform using the indicated number of values, x range, and limit types, with dataInfo indicating that the data have the given dimension. Dimension cannot be changed after construction.
